name: Scarlet Macaw
description: The Scarlet Macaw is a vibrant, large parrot known for its striking red, blue, and yellow plumage.
spread_note: Native to Central and South America, from southern Mexico to Bolivia.
food: Fruits, nuts, seeds, and occasionally insects.
food_note: Highly social, often seen foraging in pairs or small groups.
proportions: Length: 80-90 cm, wingspan: up to 120 cm, weight: about 1 kg.
reproduction: Monogamous, lays 2-4 eggs in tree cavities, incubation lasts about 25 days.
attractions: Popular in zoos and aviaries due to their colorful appearance and vocal nature.
projects_note: Conservation programs focus on habitat protection and combating illegal pet trade.
breeding: Commonly bred in captivity for conservation and pet trade.
